description: JOGO Health provides FDA-cleared virtual treatments for migraines and neurological conditions using EMG biofeedback, reducing reliance on expensive medications and surgeries.
problem_statement: JOGO addresses two critical healthcare gaps: (1) delayed access to neurologists (average 6+ months), and (2) overuse of high-cost and invasive treatments like Botox, CGRP inhibitors, and neuromodulation surgeries. Through virtual neurology consults and EMG biofeedback, JOGO offers an accessible, non-invasive alternative that lowers costs, improves outcomes, and expands access to neurological care.

market_opportunity.justification: Targets an $80B segment of the $370B neurology care market, focused on high-cost drug/surgical alternatives for common neurological conditions affecting 50%+ of employees.

product_differentiation.justification: JOGO is the only FDA-cleared, virtual EMG biofeedback solution. Combines remote consults with proprietary, hardware-enabled neurotherapy that can be deployed at scale.

go_to_market_traction.justification: $1.5M in recent revenue, $7M projected for 2025, $100M+ pipeline. Customers include Mayo Clinic and large employers. Strong commercial validation.

ecosystem_signals.justification: Backed by Mayo Clinic Ventures and Mayan Ventures (IQVIA CEO's family office). Trusted by neurologists and integrated into health system workflows.

founder_team_strength.justification: Siva Nadarajah (co-founder of Semantelli, acquired by IQVIA) brings seasoned healthcare leadership. Co-founders Gary and Sanjai add deep clinical and operational credibility.

strategic_fit.justification: Perfect fit with SV's interest in reducing healthcare costs, increasing access, and scaling digital solutions for chronic and neurological care.

red_flags: Requires physical hardware, although it is already FDA-cleared and outsourced.
Navigating employer/benefits consultant gatekeepers remains a commercial hurdle.
B2C model is optional but could add strategic complexity.

founder_profile.name: Siva Nadarajah (President), Sanjai Murali (CEO), Gary Krasilovsky (CMO)
highlights: Siva is a serial entrepreneur in digital health with prior exit to IQVIA.
Gary and Sanjai bring scientific, medical, and commercialization depth in neuro-rehab and device regulation.
Team is highly mission-aligned and has scaled to a 95-person org, showing strong hiring and operational execution.
Siva personally invested $2.5M after being approached by the founders and seeing the platform's potential.

founder_impact_assessment: Successfully transitioned JOGO from academic origins (NYU) to a commercialized, scalable digital care platform.
Built the only virtual EMG biofeedback system cleared by the FDA and deliverable nationwide.
Structured high-impact B2B and B2C pricing and delivery models with measurable ROI.
Demonstrated strong fundraising ($16M to date) and ability to attract institutional customers and partners.

sector_fit.justification: JOGO directly addresses SV's focus on digital care delivery and workforce health improvement through innovative, scalable, cost-lowering interventions.

employer_ecosystem_leverage.justification: Self-insured employers are a key target, and SV networks could unlock access past consultant gatekeepers and benefit leaders.

gtm_support_potential.justification: SV can accelerate access to benefits managers and help convert JOGO's pipeline into full-scale adoption.

strategic_partner_amplification.justification: Could integrate with MSK, chronic care, or benefit navigation platforms already supported by SV ecosystem.

acceleration_readiness.justification: Product is mature, FDA-cleared, and revenue-generating. Team is executing rapidly and ready to scale into broader employer and payer networks.

successes_and_areas_of_investigation.description: Secured $1.5M revenue in last 6 months; $7M projected for 2025 with five paying customers and a $100M+ pipeline.
successes_and_areas_of_investigation.outcome: Demonstrated product-market fit and repeatable sales motion in payer/employer channel.

successes_and_areas_of_investigation.description: Only FDA-cleared EMG biofeedback platform that can be delivered virtually.
successes_and_areas_of_investigation.outcome: Unique position to replace high-cost, high-risk neurology treatments.

successes_and_areas_of_investigation.description: Scaling employer sales despite consultant friction and complex benefits environment.
successes_and_areas_of_investigation.outcome: Needs warm intros and advisory leverage to break through and expand traction.

successes_and_areas_of_investigation.description: Managing vertical integration complexity (hardware, services, and software).
successes_and_areas_of_investigation.outcome: Currently outsourced manufacturing and proven delivery model, but needs monitoring at scale.

category_comparison: JOGO competes against pharma (e.g. Botox, CGRP drugs), surgical neuromodulation (Medtronic, Boston Scientific), and MSK/neurology platforms. Its differentiation lies in being the only FDA-cleared, non-invasive, telehealth-delivered neurotherapy with proven cost reduction and outcome improvement.

primary_competitors.name: Botox / CGRP Inhibitors
primary_competitors.description: Standard-of-care drug therapies for migraines and neurological pain.
primary_competitors.comparison: JOGO avoids side effects and long-term drug costs with a behavioral-therapy-based alternative.

primary_competitors.name: Boston Scientific / Medtronic
primary_competitors.description: Surgical neuromodulation devices for chronic neuro conditions.
primary_competitors.comparison: JOGO is non-invasive and offers a digital-first, lower-cost alternative.

primary_competitors.name: Hinge Health / Sword Health
primary_competitors.description: MSK and chronic pain digital therapy companies.
primary_competitors.comparison: JOGO applies a similar vertically integrated model but focused on neurological rather than musculoskeletal disorders.

category_comparison_expanded.conclusion: JOGO offers a rare combination of clinical validation, telehealth accessibility, and cost savings in a high-cost category. Its hybrid of virtual neurology, remote monitoring, and FDA-cleared hardware positions it as a category leader in digital neurotherapy.

final_recommendation.rationale: JOGO Health is highly aligned with SV's digital health and workforce cost-saving thesis. With strong revenue, clear differentiation, and mature go-to-market execution, it is well-positioned to scale. SV can accelerate adoption by unlocking employer network access and strengthening benefits consultant relationships.
